intro: Trachoma minuta, commonly known as the small trachoma, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa and the Middle East. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its small, delicate flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in arid or semi-arid environments. Its leaves are finely divided and aromatic, while its flowers are usually white or pale yellow. Trachoma minuta is often used in traditional medicine for its purported healing properties.
